title: Generation and utilization of a HEK-293T murine GM-CSF expressing cell line
title_html: Generation and utilization of a HEK-293T murine GM-CSF expressing cell line
document:
Extended Methods
Comprehensive Methods in the Creation of an mGM-CSF-Producing HEK293T Cell Line, Collection of mGM-CSF-rich Supernatant, and Using Cell Line Supernatant to Generate Dendritic Cells From Myeloid Progenitors
Creating Cell Line
  1. Acquire mGM-CSF gene (Addgene: Plasmid #74465)
  2. Sequence to check for correct composition
  3. PCR mGM-CSF gene
  4. Create and acquire primers with required restriction sites (NotI-HF and PspXI)
  5. PCR (F:TCCGCTCGAGCCACCATGTGGCTGCAGAATTTACTTTTCC, R:GACGCGGCCGCTCATTTTTGGCCTGGTTTTTTGC) using 2X Phusion High-Fidelity PCR Master Mix (Thermo Scientific)
  6. Purify/isolate mGM-CSF gene (450bp)
  7. Ligation of the mGM-CSF gene with 681 bidirectional vector plasmid
  8. Restriction digest 681 bidirectional vector with Not1-HF and PspXI and purify
  9. Restriction digest modified mGM-CSF gene with Not1-HF and PspXI and purify
  10. Ligate vector with thegene
  11. Transform E. coli. with 681 + GM-CSF plasmid construct
  12. Extract and isolate 681 + GM-CSF plasmid construct
  13. Incubate E. coli in liquid LB
  14. Miniprep
  15. Colony PCR and run through the gel to determine sample with GM-CSF gene inserted in 681 vector
  16. Create lentiviral constructs containing plasmid
  17. Infect HEK293 cells using lentiviral constructs
  18. Select for cells with 681 + GM-CSF plasmid construct
  19. Allow cells to recuperate from infection and grow to confluence
  20. Puro-select
  21. FACS to determine concentration of mCherry+ cells (>90% required)
  23. Collecting mGM-CSF-rich supernatant
  24. Allow for HEK293 cells with plasmid construct to grow to confluency
  25. (To be redone in T-175) Plate 2 million cells per 10 cm plate
  26. Incubate for 3 days
  27. Collect supernatant
  28. If needed to confirm the concentration of mGM-CSF in the supernatant, perform ELISA (~200 ng/ml)
  30. *In a T-175 flask
  31. Allow for HEK293 cells with plasmid construct to grow to confluency
  32. Plate 9 million cells in 50 ml DMEM per T-175 flask
  33. Incubate for 3 days
  34. Collect supernatant
  35. If needed to confirm the concentration of mGM-CSF in the supernatant, perform ELISA (~200 ng/ml)
  37. Generation of Bone-Marrow-Derived DCs
  38. Day 0
  39. Sacrifice one or two mice and reserve femur and tibia of mice
  40. Extract bone marrow cells from femur and tibia
  41. In 6 well plate, plate equal amounts of cells into each well
  42. Total media should be equal to 2 ml per well (cells + DMEM + cytokine)
  43. Incubate for three days
  44. Day 3
  45. On the third day of differentiation, wash off dead cells
  46. Aspirate media
  47. Perform PBS wash
  48. Aspirate PBS
  49. Replace media
  50. Day 4 (if cells reach confluency)
  51. On the fourth day of differentiation, move cells onto a 10cm plate
  52. Save conditioned media
  53. Perform PBS wash
  54. Aspirate PBS
  55. Using cell scraper, gently scrape cells off theplate
  56. Transfer cells onto 10 cm plate
  57. Replace media
  58. Total media should be 10 ml (cells + DMEM + cytokine)
  59. Incubate for 2-3 days
  60. Day 5 or 6
  61. Replace media
  62. Save conditioned media
  63. Perform PBS wash
  64. Aspirate PBS
  65. Replace media (10 ml total; 6.750 ml DMEM + 2 ml conditioned media + ~1.250 ml supernatant)
  66. Incubate for 1-2 days
  67. Day 7 or until usage before day 14
  68. Replace media every 2-3 days
Collecting mGM-CSF-rich supernatant
  1. Allow for HEK293 cells with plasmid construct to grow to confluency
  2. (To be redone in T-175) Plate 2 million cells per 10 cm plate
  3. Incubate for 3 days
  4. Collect supernatant
  5. If needed to confirm the concentration of mGM-CSF in the supernatant, perform ELISA (~200 ng/ml)
  7. *In a T-175 flask
  8. Allow for HEK293 cells with plasmid construct to grow to confluency
  9. Plate 9 million cells in 50 ml DMEM per T-175 flask
  10. Incubate for 3 days
  11. Collect supernatant
  12. If needed to confirm the concentration of mGM-CSF in the supernatant, perform ELISA (~200 ng/ml)

  3. Incubate for 3 days

  17. Day 7 or until usage before day 14
  18. Replace media every 2-3 days
Day 5 or 6
  1. Replace media
  2. Save conditioned media
  3. Perform PBS wash
  4. Aspirate PBS
  5. Replace media (10 ml total; 6.750 ml DMEM + 2 ml conditioned media + ~1.250 ml supernatant)
  6. Incubate for 1-2 days
  7. Day 7 or until usage before day 14
  8. Replace media every 2-3 days
Day 7 or until usage before day 14
    Cells finished differentiation. Ready for use
